Dear Dr. Watkins, Jr.:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/02/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For any repeat violations, why the prior CAP did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One of the three borrowed home files reviewed did not contain adequate
documentation to indicate the foster parent received orientation to the policies of the
borrowing agency.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record
containing all of the following documents:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One of the three borrowed home files reviewed did not include a copy of the signed
foster parent / agency agreement between the foster parent and the borrowing
agency. This was the same borrowed home file as noted above.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services worker
that has children placed in the home.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social services worker with children in the home was provided a copy of the
completed special evaluation report. REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
02/09/2021 INTERIM, CAP APPROVED 03/12/2021.
4

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
One of the six current foster child records reviewed contained an initial service plan
that was completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In this file the
initial service plan was due 04/15/2021 and it was completed 05/04/2021. REPEAT
VIOLATION ESTABLISHED 02/09/2021 INTERIM, CAP APPROVED 03/12/2021.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of the six current foster child records reviewed indicated updated service plans
that were completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In the first file
the updated service plan was due 10/12/2021 and at the time of this review the
record indicated the service plan was still pending. In the second foster child record
the updated service plan was due 10/11/2021 and it was not yet completed at the
time of this review. REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED 02/09/2021 INTERIM,
CAP APPROVED 03/12/2021.
R 400.12607 Agency recommendation.
(4) An agency shall provide the applicants for adoption with a
signed and dated copy of the evaluation and recommendation
upon its completion.
Three of the three adoptive family evaluations reviewed did not include
documentation the family received a copy of the signed adoptive evaluation. The
end of the report included signature lines for the adoptive applicants but none of the
three included signatures by the applicants.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
5

Signed copies of Adoption Closing Summary reports were not uploaded into
MISACWIS. Three closing summary reports were found but none of them included
the required signatures.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas: None needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas: None needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed
02/09/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were R
400.12422(3)(e), R 400.12324(4) (8), R 400.12310(4)(a), R 400.12327(1)(d) (4)
(5)(d) (6)(c) (7), R 400.1212(2)(d)(h), R 400.12413(1)(c)(f), R 400.12405(4), R
400.12418(1) (2)(a)(b). The only areas identified as repeat noncompliance as a part
of this review were R 400.12327(6)(c), and R 400.12418(2)(a)(b).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment identified activities to correct areas of
noncompliance as well as some analysis of previous corrective action plans. The
effects of the pandemic on the provision of services were also presented.
Interviews
Child welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences as well as
administrative staff. Individual interviews did not present any concerns.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
Safety Alert: An unlicensed relative home needed a smoke detector on the main
floor.
6

Resolution: The certification supervisor contacted the relative regarding the need
for a smoke detector on the main floor on 07/29/2021. The foster care supervisor
visited the home on 07/30/2021 and confirmed the installation of the smoke detector
and also provided picture verification.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
